definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Her matronly fame was trodden under all men's feet.
sentences.chinese: 她那主婦的聲名任憑所有的人踐踏在腳下。

sentences.english: Red fire ants like these in the American south have gotten a bad rap in our world.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，南美洲出現的這種紅火蟻已經是聲名狼藉。

sentences.english: Today, Professor Kao's reputation extends way beyond that of professor or even vice-chancellor.
sentences.chinese: 今天，高教授的聲名遠超他作爲教授乃至校長的頭銜。

sentences.english: He quickly gained a reputation as a defender of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 爲窮人辯護使他聲名鵲起。

sentences.english: Agnesi is credited with writing the first book discussing both differential and integral calculus .
sentences.chinese: 阿涅澤因撰寫了第一本討論微積分的書而聲名鵲起。

sentences.english: Many of the pilots were to achieve eminence in the aeronautical world.
sentences.chinese: 這些飛行員中很多人將會在航空界聲名顯赫。

sentences.english: It was then that Mac's special skills started to blossom.
sentences.chinese: 也就是從這時起，“夥計”獨有的技藝開始聲名遠揚。

sentences.english: He was notorious as a gambler and rake.
sentences.chinese: 他是聲名狼藉的賭徒和浪蕩子。

sentences.english: This book charts her rise to fame as an actress.
sentences.chinese: 這本書講述她的聲名鵲起而成爲一位女演員。

sentences.english: By 1920, Fox and Universal were already names to conjure with.
sentences.chinese: 到1920年，福克斯和環球已經聲名顯赫。

sentences.english: The vehicle earned its reputation during the Gulf War.
sentences.chinese: 由於在海灣戰爭中表現優異，悍馬車型聲名鵲起。

sentences.english: In those circumstances Nixon reversed his attitude toward my growing celebrity .
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，尼克松對我的聲名鵲起完全一反常態。

sentences.english: Scandals at some of the biggest comités d’entreprise have given all a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 一些最大的企業委員會的醜聞已聲名狼藉。

sentences.english: Fittingly for his formidable reputation, he was also known as Arthur Pendragon.
sentences.chinese: 以他令人敬畏的聲名，他也被稱爲亞瑟潘德拉貢。

sentences.english: His foolish behavior discredits him seriously.
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的行爲嚴重地玷污他的聲名。

definition: understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
handed down in a family/family traditions
to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
